title: How Many Calories in Semen?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in semen per average ejaculation, including protein, carbs, fat, and other nutrients for quick reference.
assumptions: Average human male ejaculation (~3-5 ml volume); composition based on typical seminal fluid with fructose, proteins, and trace nutrients.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by individual health, diet, hydration, and frequency; values are approximate. Consult medical sources for specifics.

quick_answer.text: An average ejaculation of semen contains about 10 calories, mostly from sugars and proteins.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels where applicable for comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories are in one ejaculation of semen?
faqs.a: Approximately 10 calories for an average 3-5 ml ejaculation.

faqs.q: What nutrients are in semen besides calories?
faqs.a: About 0.5 g carbs (mostly sugars), 0.5 g protein, trace fat, and 150 mg sodium.

faqs.q: Does diet affect calories in semen?
faqs.a: Yes, higher sugar intake can increase fructose and thus calories slightly.

faqs.q: How much protein is in semen?
faqs.a: Roughly 0.5 g per average ejaculation, from seminal proteins.
It contains about 150 mg sodium per ejaculation, comparable to a small pinch of salt.
